title: _act_
author: _act_
content: Fake Solana Phantom security updates push crypto-stealing malwareThis security update said to be from Phantom but no, it is from hackers. Not even a security update but instead they are NFTs that will introduce malware into your wallet to compromise and steal from it. Quote"Phantom requires all users to update their wallets. This must be done as soon as possible," reads the warning in the fake Phantom update NFT."Failing to do so, may result in loss of funds due to hackers exploiting the Solana network. Visit www.updatePhantom.com to get the latest security update."Read in details: Fake Solana Phantom security updates push crypto-stealing malware

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: Thanks for sharing it with us here most of the time, hackers are updating their strategy to steal crypto from newbies and those people that are not aware of the situation, so it's really better to just keep doing some research about preventing yourself from getting scammed and protecting your cryptos from such malicious acts. The only people who fell victim to those kinds of malware are those who don't consider taking some time to read topics that are concerning how these scammers steal people's crypto and what they need to do to prevent themselves from getting those random emails and malware.
